name: Similar to A374525, but for each starting matrix with a choice of whether to sort by columns or rows first, such that the total number of sorting steps for this matrix is minimized.
comment: This irregular triangle, read by rows, has the same structure as that of A374525, but differs starting from row 3.
example: T(3,3) = 1 because only one ([1,1,0; 1,0,1; 0,1,0]) of the A374525(3,3) = 5 matrices needs 3 sort steps irrespective of the initial sorting direction, whereas the other 4 ([0,1,1; 1,1,0; 0,0,1], [1,0,1; 0,1,1; 1,0,0], [1,0,1; 1,1,0; 0,0,1], [1,1,0; 0,1,1; 1,0,0]) can be sorted in a single step by choosing the "better" direction.
Cols     Rows     Cols     Rows stable   of initial sorting
Rows     Cols stable        Cols     Rows     Cols     Rows stable
1 sort step needed               3 sort steps needed
T(4,5)=4, because there are 4 matrices needing 5 sort steps irrespective of the choice of the initial sorting direction.
Routes of sorting for the first of these matrices, both with 5 steps:
Cols       Rows       Cols       Rows       Cols       Rows stable
Rows       Cols       Rows       Cols       Rows       Cols stable
program: (PARI) numberOfSortSteps(M, f) = {my(c=0, M1 = if (f == 0, vecsort(M), vecsort(M~)~)); if (M != M1, M = M1; c++); while (1, f = !f; M1 = if (f == 0, vecsort(M), vecsort(M~)~); if (M != M1, M = M1; c++, return(c)))};

a374526(n) = {my(v = vector(n*n), M = matrix(n,n)); while (1, v[minNumberOfSortSteps(M) + 1]++; for (i = 1, n, for (j = 1, n, if (M[i,j]++ == 1, break(2), M[i,j]=0); if (i == n && j == n, break(3))))); select(x->x>0, v)};
author: _Markus Sigg_ and _Hugo Pfoertner_, Jul 24 2024

name: T(n,k) is the number of distinct n X n {0,1}-matrices that reach a fixed point after k alternately applied sorts by rows and columns, where T(n,k), k>=0 is an irregular triangle read by rows.
comment: It is conjectured that for n>=3 the last term > 0 in row n is T(n,2*n-3). This is consistent with the result of random draws, where T(7,11) is the last term in row 7.
Approximate values ​​of the terms in the next row 7 from random drawings are as follows: 8.4E8, 3.79E12, 2.38E14, 2.54E14, 5.61E13, 1.02E13, 8.22E11, 9.0E10, 4.2E9, 3E8, 9E6, 1E6.
link: Hugo Pfoertner, PARI program, computes row n.
Markus Sigg, C program, computes row n for A374525 or A374526.
